To rid all confusions on file formats:

A file is a file is a file! For instance: A text file containing the numeric combination 123 is very hard to view in other ways than the stated, namely 123. All files on computors are (simplified) built up by numerics, based on zeros (voltage off) and ones (voltage on).

Solely based on the stored file information: One specific mkv-file does NOT show up better/worse or with more/less grainy quality on different brands of computors, mac or pc! The experience of a specific movie is ALWAYS depended on a few things:

1. The factual quality stored in the file.

2. The speed and workload capability of your computers hardware and software, also knows as THE BOTTLENECK EFFECT.

3. Lastly, and very important, but often forgotten: The way your installed movie viewing software HANDLES the information on the movie file! Vlc treats and views an mkv-file differently than Media Player Classic, based on for instance codecs and compability with the movie file.

There is one GREAT guide online, which I cannot link to due to piratebay rules, but do this exact search on google (quotaion marks included):

"Digital Video File Formats Explained"

There (videoproductiontips) Lorraine Grula explains in an easy way how it all works with compression and different movie files.

So people, please try and not put blame based om what you donĂÂ´t know nothing about. Make shure to educate yourself instead, before you bark your self to Hades! And STOP all that name calling, it really is nasty and not very polite, just hope you don't treat your kids or loved ones that way...

PVF14: There is no problem.

You RARELY see any faults in contributions the skull awarded uploaders do. When dealing with stuttering, freezing and so on: Go back to the download page! If the comments point to the fact that many can play the file without problems, the laws of LOGIC tells you there is something wrong or lacking about YOUR computer. Any other options are out of the question, unless - of course - you are just plain stubborn, stupid or those who commented they are satisfied are lying.

It's like with games for pc or them Xboxes etc: The newer the game, the higher performance a pc/box demanded (ram, mhz, video graphics card etc).

Either you convert the file to a playable state, or you wait until you can afford a better pc. That's what I did two weeks ago: Before I could NOT play this file without conversion, but now, WOW!!! I bought an Acer Aspire Laptop, 320Gb Hd, 3Gb Ram with better video graphics. It has opened up a whole new world for me!!! Even Firefox behave like a charm, without stealing memory!!!
